metadata.Title: CVE-2014-5164 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The rlc_decode_li function in epan/dissectors/packet-rlc.c in the RLC dissector in Wireshark 1.10.x before 1.10.9 initializes a certain structure member only after this member is used, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) via a crafted packet.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-5164` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
libwireshark11 - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
libwiretap8 - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
libwscodecs2 - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
libwsutil9 - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
tshark - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
wireshark - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
wireshark-common - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
wireshark-gtk - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
wireshark-qt - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.12.1+g01b65bf-2').
